ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Problem with credentials
ygData.msgSnippet: Oh - my manual scrambling of hostname was ineffective ;-) arto.dk should have been foo.dk in the crawl.log extract. So - the correct crawl.log is:

Oh - my manual scrambling of hostname was ineffective ;-)

arto.dk should have been foo.dk in the crawl.log extract.

So - the correct crawl.log is:
2007-08-07T09:05:01.510Z     1         52 dns:www.foo.dk P http://www.foo.dk/ text/dns #014 20070807090500909+76 
sha1:ZFEUC72STTHW6WGT3CQ7FSC5ZELHUCDG - -
2007-08-07T09:05:01.920Z   200          0 http://www.foo.dk/robots.txt P http://www.foo.dk/ text/plain #003 20070807090501840+75 
sha1:3I42H3S6NNFQ2MSVX7XZKYAYSCX5QBYJ - -
2007-08-07T09:05:02.234Z   -50          - http://www.foo.dk/ - - no-type #014 - - - 3t
2007-08-07T09:05:02.481Z   200         88 http://www.foo.dk/login.asp P http://www.foo.dk/ text/html #001 20070807090502240+221 
sha1:3KZ4VXNSIFLJTECHCFGTXFRCPCNDOZAZ - -
2007-08-07T09:05:03.276Z   200      31157 http://www.foo.dk/seed2.html - - text/html #041 20070807090502792+82 
sha1:5RKIJVDCIFWGCCYH73GXG6TGL6LIYT7F - -

The login-page was just made up as example - not existing in realworld.

Why does seed-1 end up with status-code -50 ?? - after login it should be retried and end with a normal code 200

My problem still is that one of the seeds from the login-domaine does not get crawled after login - and if the order of the seeds can't be 
guaranteed the workaround is not really applicable (allthough all my tests have been taking seeds in the exact order of the seeds-file - 
maybe this is because of a very low number of seeds ?? < 10)

best
Bjarne Andersen

Michael Stack wrote:
> 
> 
> Looking at your log below, it seems that www.foo.dk is
> http://www.arto.dk/ <http://www.arto.dk/> <http://www.arto.dk/ 
> <http://www.arto.dk/>> and the login page is
> http://www.arto.dk/login.asp. <http://www.arto.dk/login.asp.> If that is 
> so, if I go to the latter
> link, I get a 200 code and '*Siden blev desv�rre ikke fundet!'* (My
> danish is not the best but if I was to guess.... ).
> 
> The authentication code isn't too smart. Per site you designate a login
> page. As soon as it trips over the site, it runs the auth against the
> designated login page. Are you configuring a login for both seeds? If
> its even possible, double-login should be harmless. IIRC, the order in
> which seeds are crawled can not be guaranteed. Otherwise, you could set
> up auth for the seed that will be crawled first (as you suggest below).
> 
> St.Ack
> 
> Bjarne Andersen wrote:
>  >
>  > When I try setting up credentials for a HTML-login on some page I have
>  > a problem with the first seed not getting crawled.
>  >
>  > I have 2 seeds:
>  > http://www.foo.dk/ <http://www.foo.dk/> <http://www.foo.dk/ 
> <http://www.foo.dk/>>
>  > http://www.foo.dk/seed2.html <http://www.foo.dk/seed2.html> 
> <http://www.foo.dk/seed2.html <http://www.foo.dk/seed2.html>>
>  >
>  > The top of the crawl-log goes:
>  > 2007-08-07T09:05:01.510Z 1 52 dns:www.foo.dk P http://www.foo.dk/ 
> <http://www.foo.dk/>
>  > <http://www.foo.dk/ <http://www.foo.dk/>> text/dns #014 
> 20070807090500909+76
>  > sha1:ZFEUC72STTHW6WGT3CQ7FSC5ZELHUCDG - -
>  > 2007-08-07T09:05:01.920Z 200 0 http://www.foo.dk/robots.txt 
> <http://www.foo.dk/robots.txt>
>  > <http://www.foo.dk/robots.txt <http://www.foo.dk/robots.txt>> P 
> http://www.foo.dk/ <http://www.foo.dk/>
>  > <http://www.foo.dk/ <http://www.foo.dk/>> text/plain #003 
> 20070807090501840+75
>  > sha1:3I42H3S6NNFQ2MSVX7XZKYAYSCX5QBYJ - -
>  > 2007-08-07T09:05:02.234Z -50 - http://www.foo.dk/ 
> <http://www.foo.dk/> <http://www.foo.dk/ <http://www.foo.dk/>>
>  > - - no-type #014 - - - 3t
>  > 2007-08-07T09:05:02.481Z 200 88 http://www.foo.dk/login.asp 
> <http://www.foo.dk/login.asp>
>  > <http://www.foo.dk/login.asp <http://www.foo.dk/login.asp>> P 
> http://www.arto.dk/ <http://www.arto.dk/>
>  > <http://www.arto.dk/ <http://www.arto.dk/>> text/html #001 
> 20070807090502240+221
>  > sha1:3KZ4VXNSIFLJTECHCFGTXFRCPCNDOZAZ - -
>  > 2007-08-07T09:05:03.276Z 200 31157 http://www.foo.dk/seed2.html 
> <http://www.foo.dk/seed2.html>
>  > <http://www.foo.dk/seed2.html <http://www.foo.dk/seed2.html>> - - 
> text/html #041 20070807090502792+82
>  > sha1:5RKIJVDCIFWGCCYH73GXG6TGL6LIYT7F - -
>  >
>  > And the crawler does the login - finds out that the login-page is a
>  > prerequisit (P) to the first seed
>  >
>  > But the first seed never gets retried after the login - ends with
>  > status-code (-50)
>  >
>  > If I add a dummy seed to the top of the seed-list things seem to work.
>  > But does the crawler guarentee that the order of seeds in the
>  > seed-list is always the crawling-order ?
>  >
>  > If my seedlist have only the first seed the crawler stops after the
>  > login-page no matter what
>  >
>  > best
